subject: Philosophy
title: Socrates and the Examined Life
description: A quick win: understand Socrates and the Examined Life.

hook.text: Socrates never wrote a single word. Yet he became the most famous philosopher ever.

buildup.text: He wandered Athens asking powerful people simple questions â€” and exposing their ignorance.

discovery.text: His method was pure questioning. He claimed to know nothing, forcing others to think deeper.

twist.text: Athens charged him with corrupting the youth. He was sentenced to death by hemlock.

climax.text: He refused to escape, choosing to die for his principles rather than flee.

punchline.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.

quiz.question: Why was Socrates sentenced to death?
